Great permanent role for a Data Scientist enthused by all things tech - it's a real opportunity to make your mark.
THE COMPANY
Our client helps technology-led businesses invent better futures by creating products
column2: services and business models that drive sustainable growth.

column1: They are a team of researchers and strategists with diverse backgrounds across anthropology
column2: business consultancy
column3: digital product development
column4: data and design. They specialise in the interactions between people and technology
column5: combining approaches from social and data science to give companies a foundational understanding of the world
column6: their customers and their organisations. It's a fast growing business with an international presence.

column1: THE ROLE

Our client is looking for an energetic and ambitious Data Scientist to take on project leadership responsibilities for analysis and contribute to the development of their social and data science integration.

You'll be using your experience and skills to make good judgements about the combination of methods best applied to solve specific problems. You'll also help build the integration of disciplines across social science and data science by contributing to the thinking as to how to do this
column2: and by practically building products
column3: processes and ways to achieve this.

column1: You'll also have the opportunity to take ownership of standalone pieces within this development.
This consultancy is London based and the team are working on a hybrid basis i.e. a couple of days a week required in the office.
YOU
We'd love to hear from you if you are/have:
- previous experience as a data scientist
- exceptional analytical skills - and demonstrable ability to make good judgements about what sort of analysis to conduct to solve specific problems
- experience in applying multiple types of data science methods in solving problems for organisations
- excellent knowledge of statistics (e.g. hypothesis testing
column2: regression analysis etc.)

column1: - exceptional coding skills: experienced in R or Python
- experience using data visualisation methods and tools
- the right to work/live in the UK
If this sounds like you

column2: and to identify new opportunities. Currently there are over 100 staff within the global DSO team
column3: made up of high-quality data science and engineering professionals covering BI architecture and platform support

column1: Due to team expansion DSO are looking to recruit talented
column2: highly driven individuals who have excelled in previous roles and are looking for a new challenge in a dynamic and rewarding environment.

column1: Overview
Data Scientists in the DSO team apply advanced analytical methods and tools to drive value from the data through techniques such as customer segmentation
column2: predictive modelling
column3: forecasting and other algorithms. Our work delivers an in depth understanding of consumer behaviors and supports multi-channel targeting and personalization.

column1: As a senior data scientist in our team
column2: you will enable a wide range of internal stakeholders across our business to better understand our customers and make data-driven decisions to drive customer lifetime value. You will apply a range of data science methods
column3: build a range of data driven products and develop a deep understanding of what makes our business tick.

column1: What You’ll Be Doing
You will work in a globally distributed agile team
column2: supporting stakeholders throughout the business in areas such as marketing
column3: operations

column1: Have the interest and aptitude to quickly develop a deep understanding of what makes our customers tick through understanding the data. And you will have the inter-personal and technical skills to work across the business to bring that insight to application.

Lead a wide range of analytical project activities: from requirements gathering through data modelling and processing; carrying out segmentation or building predictive models; performing deep insight; presenting findings to stakeholders and building reusable data products through close collaboration with the relevant data engineering teams.
You could have a background in data sciences

column3: computer science

column1: You will work with Product Managers in DSO to gather requirements from stakeholders

Infogrid is helping protect the planet and improve the lives of billions of people by making every building a smart building.

Our goal is to be the global provider for connected devices in smart buildings. We already handle millions of events every day from tens of thousands of sensors and we’d like you to help us scale that by an order of magnitude over the coming months.
Sustainability is at our heart; buildings account for 39% of global carbon emissions and we’re creating real solutions to impact this!

column1: Background
The FCA is the prudential regulator of 49
column2: 000 financial services firms. We want resilient firms who have financial resources that are commensurate to their activities and that minimise the potential for harm – both in life and in failure.

column1: The Financial Resilience Department (FRD) is one of the specialist departments in the FCA. FRD’s mission is to provide high quality prudential expertise across all sectors
column2: and support the FCA more broadly
column3: in seeking to assess and mitigate the prudential causes of harm. Through this we deliver public value.

column1: What does the role involve?
We deliver on our mission by: using data science and analysis to spot risks across the 49
column2: 000 firms; assessing the adequacy of firm's financial resources – both through individual firm assessments and multi firm work; and targeting firms with the highest risk of harm. FRD is also responsible for supporting the supervision of Securitisations and Regulatory Covered Bonds (structured finance).

column1: There are five teams in the department who work closely together with lots of cross team working. This role involves using your data science and analysis skills to identify risks
column2: trends and outlier firms allowing us to assess and mitigate harm at an early stage by improving our predictive capability and prioritisation.

column1: What are the key responsibilities?
The Data Science Associate in the department will be responsible for:

deploying a range of data science and analytics techniques to develop usable insights that support both FRD and supervisionproviding support to colleagues in the department on data and analysisengaging with the community of data experts and specialists within the department and outsideidentifying cross-cutting trends and themes and reporting these via governance channels and local managementensuring our work has impact and influence.role modelling Judgement

column3: Delivery and Self-Management and the FCA values

column1: What will the candidate get from the role?

This role therefore provides exposure to both a breadth and a depth of issues. You will be responsible for high profile work which protects both the consumers and the market. You will be part of a growing community of data science professionals and will drive the implementation of FRD’s data strategy.
Working in a team of prudential specialists
column2: you will have a rare opportunity to understand and shape the workings of the financial sector at a time of considerable change. You will enjoy a unique perspective on the financial services industry
column3: with the opportunity to do meaningful work that makes a real difference.

column1: To deliver on this ambition of being Powered by Data strategy we need talent with expertise and experience of data science and advanced analytics to deliver multiple initiatives and join the change in data and pet- and pet-centric thinking across the entire Mars Petcare business.

The purpose of this role is to join and be an integral part of the expanding data science function and to deliver the Powered By Data project across Mars Petcare divisions using the ecosystem of data available.

This will involve building a clear understanding of the potential benefits that connected data and analytics can bring and supporting this vision with stakeholders. The role involves hands-on delivery of analytics and insight.

column1: As one of Europe’s fastest growing independent companies
column2: you’ll be part of an exciting
column3: expanding team and trailblazing company.

column1: Food and tech is at the heart of what we do. Technology
column2: Data Science and AI are at the heart of Gousto. The code we write powers every aspect of our business from the recommendation engine powering our e-commerce experience right down to the genetic algorithms used to efficiently route boxes in our warehouse.

column1: Join us and let’s dream big and deliver bigger.
Unbox possibility.
Senior Data Scientist
We have a new opportunity within our Data Science team for a Senior Data Scientist to lead on Data Science products & projects in our Unbox tribe!
Our technology & operations are growing. The Senior Data Scientist will drive cross functional working and ensure Data Science is optimised in all areas possible!
Our operations

column3: ingredients
column4: resources and customer distribution is key to ensuring the quality and convenience we want our customers to have.

column1: As Senior Data Scientist you will be experienced driving successful data science projects and team delivery. At Gousto we look to support and develop our people at all levels and are passionate about continued development within Data Science.
You’ll enjoy collaborating with fellow Data Scientists
column2: Data Engineers
column3: Software Engineers and Product Managers

column1: If you’re a natural problem solver and are passionate about data

column1: To be successful and more importantly enjoy being at Data Scientist at Gousto; you will be passionate about finding solutions for our customers.
Join us and let’s dream big and deliver bigger.
Give it some Gousto.
Who You Are

Adventurer in data science - As a senior member of the data-science team you will be using advanced machine-learning and optimisation techniques to build tools that will improve the business and make our service highly personalised. We look to our senior team members to unlock new step changes in performance for our existing data products
column2: introduce new theories and technologies to the team and leverage data science in new areas of the business.End-to-end owner of data products - The problems we pursue are diverse and have a direct impact on the business. They range from optimising flows in our warehouse to algorithmically designing the layouts of each factory. We believe that if you build something
column3: you should run it too. This means that our data scientists take ownership over the entire process from ideation to deployment
column4: as well as automation and maintenance. Knowing our data products inside-out allows us to keep learning and improving.Passionate about impact - We have big plans for the future
column5: hence we are looking for creative thinkers to help drive the business and disrupt the online grocery market by leveraging machine learning and optimisation. You will work with amazing colleagues and look forward to solving challenging problems that will have significant impact on the product and our customers. You’ll recognise when to meet complex problems with advanced solutions or when a simple approach cuts through all complexity. Most of all
column6: you are excited about Gousto’s mission and product and really enjoy working with the team.Relentlessly raising the bar – We believe that one of the most important things our Senior Data Scientists do is educate the more junior members of the team. We’re looking for someone who can bring new and innovative engineering practices into the team
column7: someone who is willing to help educate and help to improve what we do on a daily basis. As a senior member of the team
column8: you’re always on the lookout for opportunities to help the team fulfill their potential.

column1: Your background
MSc or PhD in Machine Learning
column2: Math
column3: Stats
column4: Computer Science or BSc paired with strong industry experienceStrong proven understanding of optimisation algorithms and machine learning techniquesExperience in Optimisation Theory & Constraint ProgrammingComfortable using python and SQLExperience with managing productionisation of data productsExperience measuring and managing data product performanceGreat communication skills – being able to explain your work and the impact on the business to all types of business partnersHigh-energy self-starter with a passion for data

column1: Bonus Points For
Experience in Evolutionary ComputationExperience with Airflow or MLflowExperience with pysparkExperience in deploying machine learning algorithms into production environments (AWS)
Our Values
Dream - Today’s good is tomorrow’s mediocre. We’re always looking for ways to improve Gousto
column2: our team and ourselves.

column1: Deliver - We understand where we can add the most value and obsess about making improvements every day.
Care - We can only achieve big things by working collaboratively. We respect different people’s skills
column2: experience and points of view. We work as one team.

column1: Background
The FCA is the prudential regulator of 49
column2: 000 financial services firms. We want resilient firms who have financial resources that are commensurate to their activities and that minimise the potential for harm – both in life and in failure.

column1: The Financial Resilience Department (FRD) is one of the specialist departments in the FCA. FRD’s mission is to provide high quality prudential expertise across all sectors
column2: and support the FCA more broadly
column3: in seeking to assess and mitigate the prudential causes of harm. Through this we deliver public value.

column1: What does the role involve?
We deliver on our mission by: using data science and analysis to spot risks across the 49
column2: 000 firms; assessing the adequacy of firm's financial resources – both through individual firm assessments and multi firm work; and targeting firms with the highest risk of harm. FRD is also responsible for supporting the supervision of Securitisations and Regulatory Covered Bonds (structured finance).

column1: There are five teams in the department who work closely together with lots of cross team working. This role involves using your data science and analysis skills to identify risks
column2: trends and outlier firms allowing us to assess and mitigate harm at an early stage by improving our predictive capability and prioritisation.

column1: What are the key responsibilities?
The Data Science Associate in the department will be responsible for:

deploying a range of data science and analytics techniques to develop usable insights that support both FRD and supervisionproviding support to colleagues in the department on data and analysisengaging with the community of data experts and specialists within the department and outsideidentifying cross-cutting trends and themes and reporting these via governance channels and local managementensuring our work has impact and influence.role modelling Judgement

column3: Delivery and Self-Management and the FCA values

This role therefore provides exposure to both a breadth and a depth of issues. You will be responsible for high profile work which protects both the consumers and the market. You will be part of a growing community of data science professionals and will drive the implementation of FRD’s data strategy.
Working in a team of prudential specialists

The primary focus of the role is to develop Machine Learning algorithms on high scale-high complexity rich medical data to predict answers to healthcare challenges. The role requires the ability to analyse and understand complex healthcare problems and develop analytical solutions to tackle and solve them.
You will be using existing machine learning tools and you will be responsible of tailoring them as business problems require. As part of this role

column3: therefore good communication skills are also necessary.

column1: About the RoleAt Deliveroo we have a world-class data science organisation
column2: with a mission to enable the highest quality human and machine decision making. We work throughout the company - in product
column3: business and platform teams. We are uniquely placed to connect and calibrate quantitative decision making throughout Deliveroo and have strong relationships with our business partners.

column1: Our team members use technical skills from the whole spectrum of data science: building analytical tools; informing decision making at all levels of the business via bespoke and automated analysis; running experiments; performing causal analysis; informing planning and prioritisation with robust impact estimates; building production machine learning and optimisation models; upskilling the entire company in data literacy and data-driven decision making.
At Deliveroo we’re always experimenting. We have hungry customers
column2: eager riders
column3: and busy restaurants in 12 countries and over 200 cities and giving them what they want and need involves continually testing new ideas. Whether we’re working to improve our restaurant recommendations or looking to find a more efficient algorithm for routing our drivers
column4: experimentation helps us make the right decisions for our users.

column1: Experimenting at this scale presents some unique challenges and we’re investing heavily in building a world-class platform for designing
column2: deploying
column3: and analysing product experiments. We’re looking for experts in statistical inference and estimation to join our growing team of data scientists and help us develop innovative statistical solutions for industrial-scale experimentation.

column1: Some of the problems we’re working to solve:How can we monitor possible interaction effects across our experiments? How can we account for such effects in the analysis of our experiments?How can we improve our inference techniques to correctly account for the many statistical tests we calculate? Once we have chosen such a correction
column2: how can we account for it at the power calculation stage?How can statistical methods help us estimate the long-term impact of experiments?How can we leverage modern statistical algorithms in order to identify any business-relevant heterogeneity of treatment effects?How can we avoid running afoul the selection bias across the many experiments we run? Can we use shrinkage estimators to get closer to the actual impact of an experiment once rolled out?How can we use the outcomes of previous experiments to improve our inference for a given experiment?

column1: Responsibilities:Investigating complex methodological problems and working collaboratively with a small team of experts to establish world-class standards for experimentation. Leveraging your broad statistical awareness to proactively identify opportunities to add to and improve our existing experimentation methodsPrototyping and amending statistical methods to fit our specific circumstancesPrototyping the code and providing clear communication and written documentation for the engineering team
Qualifications:PhD in statistics
column2: economics
column3: econometrics
column4: or a relevant field of applied mathematicsBroad statistical awareness
column5: including familiarity with frequentist and Bayesian approaches
column6: and a demonstrated ability for developing innovative experimentation and analysis methodsFamiliarity with a scripting language
column7: some proficiency with Python would be an asset

column1: Data Science at DeliverooWe are a small team
column2: with a very large impact
column3: seeking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast
column4: we’re always looking for new ideas and we’re very transparent about the decisions we make and why we make them.

column1: There are so many questions we need to answer and plenty more we haven’t even encountered. How do data and technology help restaurants to grow as consumer habits change? How can we predict what someone wants to order for dinner long before the idea has even crossed their mind? At Deliveroo these are just some of the tough problems we are solving - and there is no challenge that cannot be yours. No solution is owned by a particular team
column2: which means the scope for growth and personal impact is enormous.

column4: religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest-growing startups in an incredibly exciting space.

column1: The Company

Plum Guide is on a mission to build the definitive collection of the world's most remarkable home-stays. We are taking a systematic approach to vetting every single home on the planet and accepting only the top 3%. Like a Michelin Guide
column2: but for homes. We do it by putting every home in a destination through a systematic vetting process

column4: interviewing hosts and sending our Home Critics to visit and test nominated homes in person.

column1: We launched in 2016. Since then we have grown incredibly quickly; expanded to 345 locations in 29 countries; tested over 600

column1: About The Data Team

We are a small but high performing team who work with every team across the business as well as building our own projects. We are highly respected in the business and are getting ever-increasing responsibility for delivering new growth opportunities or finding efficiencies.
Some of the work done by the data team that we have written about:
CriticNet: Scaling the business with Deep Learning CriticNet: Scaling the business with Deep Learning — Part 2
Plum Guide and the Data Team's focus for the next 12 months is on hyperscale and hypergrowth: taking Plum Guide truly global. This is where you come in.
The Role

We believe in creating the best experience for our guests and hosts while being able to move fast and operate at scale. This role will have a significant impact on improving our search experience as we move towards personalization and surfacing much richer data to our users.

We also want to be able to find the best homes and ensure they have accurate pricing so our guests know they are getting the best deal. We support this initiative by building sophisticated models to find homes
column2: scraping data and combining it with our own data to price homes correctly.

column1: This role will be in the Data team but there will be significant collaboration with the Product & Tech team to implement these solutions.

We want to be able to show each user the right types of homes at the right time in order to increase our chances of them buying. To do this we need to develop ranking and personalisation algorithms.
